def give_last(arr):
    last_value = arr[0]
    t = 0
    while t < len(arr):
        last_value = arr[t]
        t += 1
    return last_value

`last_value_i = give_last(arr[i-1])`

In other words, the value of `last_value` for the i-th iteration of the loop is equal to the result of calling `give_last` on the (i-1)-th element of the array. This invariant proves that the function is working correctly for each iteration of the loop, because it maintains the last value correctly.
